The people of Uttarakuru are not completely naked, nor are they half-naked. They have no likes or dislikes. Their teeth are all even, close together, without gaps or missing teeth, good, clean, and white, like conches, bright and pleasing.

When the people of Uttarakuru are hungry and thirsty and need food and drink, they take it without ever having to plow or plant. The rice is naturally grown, pure, clean, and white, without any husks or chaff.

If those people wish to eat the food, they sit at their seats.

At that time, for those who come from the east, west, north, and south to eat, food is prepared for them, and the food is never exhausted, until those who offer the food sit down and do not get up, and then the food always fills up.

Those who eat that naturally grown nonglutinous rice, which is cooked and free of husks, is pure, fragrant, and delicious without the need for soup, and has all the flavors complete, white like a cluster of flowers, and its color is like the taste of heavenly ghee.

When those people eat this food, their bodies are filled and do not lack anything, they are neither old nor changing, and remain still and unmoving, and until that food benefits them, they have perfect complexion, strength, peace, and eloquence.
Bhiká¹£us!
If the people of Uttarakuru have a lustful mind towards a woman, and the woman reciprocates, they will look at each other, and the woman will follow that person to a tree.

If that woman is his mother, aunt, or sister, for their sake the branches of that tree will not bend down, its leaves will wither and fall, they will not cover each other, it will not produce flowers, nor will there be bedding;

If she is not his mother, aunt, or sister, then the trees will immediately bend down, the branches and leaves will be lush, the branches will shade each other, the flowers will be fresh and vibrant, and for that person, they will produce hundreds of thousands of kinds of bedding and sleeping mats. Monks!
The people of Uttarakuru stay in the womb for seven days, and on the eighth day, the woman gives birth.
After giving birth, whether it is a boy or a girl, they immediately place the child in the middle of the four-way crossroads and abandon it.

Then, people from the east, west, south, and north who come by, in order to raise the boy or girl, each put their finger into the boy or girl's mouth. Sweet milk comes out from the tip of their fingers, which they give to the boy or girl to drink, and they survive.
In this way, after seven days, the boy or girl's body grows to the same size as the people there, without any difference.
If it is a boy, he follows the male companions and goes along with them.
If it is a girl, she follows the female companions and goes away with them.
Bhiká¹£us!
The lifespan of the Ut-tara-kuru people is fixed, without premature death. When their lives end, they are immediately reborn above.
Next, for what reasons do the Ut-tara-kuru people have a fixed lifespan, and after death, all go upwards?
Bhiká¹£us!
In the world, there is one person who exclusively kills, steals others' possessions, engages in sexual misconduct, lies, speaks divisively, harshly, and idly, is greedy, hateful, and has wrong views;
due to these causes and conditions, when their body perishes and life ends, they will fall into a bad path and be reborn in hell.

There is another person who has never killed, does not steal others' things, does not engage in sexual misconduct, does not lie, does not speak divisively, does not speak harshly or idly, is not greedy or hateful, and does not have wrong views;
due to these causes and conditions, when their body perishes and life ends, they will go towards a good path and be reborn among humans or gods.
What are the causes and conditions for being born below?
It is due to killing, wrong views, and so forth.
Those born above are due to not killing, right views, and so forth.
Furthermore, there is a person who thinks like this:
'I should now practice the ten wholesome [deeds].'
For this cause and condition, when the body perishes, they will be born among the Uttarakurus.
Having been born there, they will live for a thousand years, neither increasing nor decreasing.

After making such wholesome vows, practicing the ten wholesome deeds, when the body perishes, they will be born among the Uttarakurus. There, their lifespan will be a full thousand years, neither increasing nor decreasing.
Bhiká¹£us!
For this cause and condition, the Uttarakurus have a fixed lifespan.
Bhiká¹£us!
What are the causes and conditions for being born above?
Bhiká¹£us!
The people of JambudvÄ«pa, having received the ten wholesome deeds from others, will be reborn among the Uttarakuru people when their bodies perish.
If the Uttarakuru people already possess the ten wholesome deeds in full, and having practiced in accordance with the Dharma, when their bodies perish they will all be reborn in the heavens above.
Bhiká¹£us!
For this reason, the Uttarakuru people are reborn in a superior place above.
Bhiká¹£us!

When the lifespan of the Uttarakuru people is exhausted, there is no one who grieves or weeps. They only adorn themselves, leave their bodies in the middle of the four great thoroughfares, and depart.
Bhiká¹£us!
The Uttarakuru people have such a Dharma.
When the lifespan of those beings is exhausted, at that time a bird will fly in, called the Ucchuá¹£ma (Skt. ucchushma).
At that time, the bird Ucchuá¹£ma flew swiftly from the great mountain valley, picked up the hair, and threw the corpse onto another continent.
Why is it so?
Because the people of Uttarakuru have pure karma, and their desires are happy, so they do not allow the foul stench to be blown by the wind.
Bhiká¹£us!
When the people of Uttarakuru want to defecate or urinate, the ground opens up for them, and after they finish, it closes up again.
Why is it so?
Because the people of Uttarakuru have pure desires, and their desires are happy.
Furthermore, what is the reason for calling that continent Uttarakuru?
Bhiká¹£us!

As for Uttarakuru, compared to the other three continents in the four continents, it is the highest, most wonderful, and most excellent. Therefore, Uttarakuru is called Uttarakuru (Uttarakuru in Chinese means above).

Bhiká¹£us!
What is meant by the wheel-turning sage king being endowed with the wheel treasure?
Bhiká¹£us!
When the wheel-turning king appears in JambudvÄ«pa, he is consecrated with water and becomes a Cakravartin.

On the Poá¹£adha day, the fifteenth day when the moon is full, he bathes his hair, puts on an untorn white cloth, lets his hair hang down, adorns himself with maá¹‡i jewels and various necklaces, and is surrounded in front and behind by relatives and ministers on the pavilion.

At that time, the anointed Cakravartin Wheel-Turning King thinks like this:
'I have heard such words before:

If there is an anointed Chakri king, on the fifteenth day of the month when the full moon is perfectly round, after washing his hair, wearing unwoven white cloth, adorned with all kinds of necklaces, on the top of the palace, surrounded in front and back by relatives and ministers,

at that time, in front of the king, there will naturally appear the heavenly golden wheel treasure, with a thousand spokes, hub and rim, all the characteristics complete, naturally coming in response, not made by craftsmen, all golden in color, the diameter of the wheel being seven cubits.

At that time, the anointed Chakri wheel-turning king, wanting to test the heavenly wheel treasure, immediately ordered the four divisions of the army to be prepared, namely the elephant division, the horse division, the chariot division, and the infantry division.

Having equipped his body with the four kinds of power, he immediately went to the side of the heavenly golden wheel, and when he arrived, he bared his right arm, knelt on his right knee in front of the golden wheel, touched the heavenly wheel treasure with his right hand, and said:

Then the heavenly wheel treasure immediately turned, in order to subdue those that had not yet been subdued.
Bhiká¹£us!

At that time, King CÄturmahÄrÄja, having seen the heavenly wheel treasure turn, the wheel-turning king then immediately set out to travel to the east, and the heavenly wheel treasure, as well as the four kinds of troops of elephants, horses, and infantry, all followed.

In front of the wheel treasure, there are also four great heavenly bodies moving. Wherever the heavenly wheel treasure arrives and stops, the wheel-turning king and the four divisions of troops, including the powerful elephants and horses, all stay there and rest.

At that time, all the kings of the eastern countries each took golden vessels filled with silver grains, or silver vessels filled with golden grains, and after preparing these, they all went to where the wheel-turning king was. Having arrived, they addressed the wheel-turning king, saying:
'Great King, welcome!

We only wish that the great heavenly king would deign to accept it out of pity for us small kings.

Then, the wheel-turning king said to the kings:
'If you can do this with a sincere mind, then each of you should rule your own realm according to the Dharma, and do not let there be any unrighteousness in your lands.
Why is this so?

Now I teach you to abandon killing, to teach others not to kill, not to take what is not given, to not engage in sexual misconduct, to not speak falsely, and so forth, up to not hold wrong views.

If you and others abandon killing, teach others not to kill, do not take what is not given, do not engage in sexual misconduct, speak truthfully, and hold right views, then I will know that you kings have subdued your lands.'

At that time, the kings of the various countries in the east, having heard this edict from the wheel-turning king, all at once accepted the ten wholesome courses of action. Having accepted them, they upheld them and each ruled their own lands according to the Dharma.
This wheel-turning king, by the power of his freedom, wherever he goes, the precious wheel follows.
At that time, the sacred king's heavenly golden wheel treasure, having thus subdued the countries in the east, reached the eastern coast and circled all around.
In succession, it went to the south, west, and even the north, leading the way along the path of the wheel-turning kings of old.
When the wheel-turning king and the four divisions of his army were traveling in succession, in front of the heavenly wheel treasure, there were also four great heavenly beings leading the way.

At that time, all the kings of the northern countries also each brought heavenly genuine gold vessels filled with silver grains, and heavenly genuine silver vessels filled with gold grains, and came to where the wheel-turning king was. Having arrived, they knelt for a long time and said these words:
'Excellent, O Heaven, come!
Excellent, O Heaven, come!
We in the north, because of the Heavenly King, have a flourishing population, abundant harvests, peace and security, and are free from all fears. It is very delightful.
If Heaven remains to govern and transform, we will follow and comply.'
The wheel-turning king then issued an order, saying:
'If you can do so, each of you should govern your own territory in accordance with the teachings, without acting contrary to the Dharma.
Why is this?
Do not let there be non-virtuous people or evildoers in my realm.
Moreover, you should not kill, nor should you teach others to kill. Do not take what is not given, engage in sexual misconduct, speak falsely, or even hold wrong views. You should all abandon these.
If you can refrain from killing, up to and including practicing right view, if you can do this, then I will know that you have well subdued your countries.'
Those kings all jointly addressed the wheel-turning king, saying:
'As the gods command, I shall respectfully carry it out.'
At that time, the kings of the northern countries, having heard the Wheel-Turning King's decree like this, each followed and accepted the ten wholesome actions.

By the power of the Wheel-Turning King's sovereignty, wherever he went, the divine wheel treasure followed and moved.

After subduing the north, crossing the northern shore of the ocean, the lands all around, having completely circled, returned.

At that time, in the JambudvÄ«pa, they first selected the most supreme, majestic, and extremely exquisite land. The divine wheel treasure should be above it, with a width of seven yojanas from east to west, and a circumference of twelve yojanas from south to north.

Once completed, it was of wondrous color and perfect form, made of the four treasures: heavenly gold, silver, crystal, and lapis lazuli.
At that time, the true golden wheel treasure of that sage king hovered in the sky above the palace gate, standing still like a wheel mounted on an axle, not shaking or moving.
When the wheel-turning king was at that time, he gave rise to great joy and boundless exhilaration, and had this thought:
Have I now received the heavenly wheel treasure?
Bhiká¹£us!
That wheel-turning king has such a form, and the heavenly golden wheel treasure is naturally complete.
Bhiká¹£us!

This wheel-turning king, when sitting in the palace in the morning, the elephant treasure would appear before the king.

The elephant had a wonderful color and pure white body, like a jasmine flower, with seven parts touching the ground, possessing great spiritual power, flying through the sky. That wheel-turning king has in this way the white elephant treasure, which is naturally complete.
Bhiká¹£us!

At the time of the first watch of the day, the wheel-turning king sits in the palace hall, and in front of the king, the dark-blue horse treasure appears.

The wheel-turning king, until he had his meal.

The wheel-turning king has such a color horse treasure.

If the heavenly king needs wealth and treasures for use, may the heavenly king not worry. I can provide everything that the heavenly king needs.

At that time, the wheel-turning king, wanting to test the minister of the treasury, went to the water's edge, boarded a boat, sat on the boat in the middle of the river, and said to the minister of the treasury:

'I do not need the wealth, I was just testing you.'

The wheel-turning king is thus endowed with the complete treasure of the minister.

What are the characteristics of the wheel-turning sage king's treasure of the general, the complete majesty?

Because of the wheel-turning king's power of merit and virtue, the treasure of the general is spontaneously born. He is skilled in strategy, has many plans, thoroughly understands military affairs, and is fully endowed with spiritual wisdom.
If the wheel-turning king needs military power, he can immediately provide it.

Then the treasure of the general immediately goes to where the wheel-turning king is, and upon arrival, addresses the wheel-turning king, saying:

Then, the wheel-turning king, wanting to test the power of the military treasure, ordered the four divisions of the army to be assembled, namely the elephant division, the horse division, the chariot division, and the infantry division, all of which were to be assembled.
Having ordered the four divisions of the army to be assembled, the king then ordered the military treasure, saying:

'You, the commander of the army, well prepare the army for me, train them to be obedient, good at running, good at marching, good at gathering, and good at dispersing, in accordance with the Dharma, without transgression.'
When the commander of the army heard this order from the wheel-turning king, he said to the great king:
'As the king commands, I dare not disobey.'
The four divisions of the army were all fully equipped. Following the king's orders, they could run when told to run, scatter when told to scatter, and even stop when told to stop.
For this reason, the wheel-turning king experienced great joy and boundless elation, thinking, 'I have now given birth to the treasure of the general who commands the army.'
Bhiká¹£us!
The wheel-turning king has such a form, and the treasure of the general who commands the army is endowed with majestic power.
Bhiká¹£us!
If there are such seven treasures appearing, only then can one be called a wheel-turning sage king.
Bhiká¹£us!

That wheel-turning king has a long life span and lives for a long time. In the past, at the time of the kalpa, there was no one born in the world who could live in such peace and for such a long time as that wheel-turning king, who lived a long life.

Moreover, bhiká¹£us!
The body that the wheel-turning king receives is free from illness and has few afflictions, and is endowed with all characteristics.

At the time of the kalpa and the time of the samÄya, there is no other person born in the world who has so few illnesses and no afflictions like that sage king.
This is called the second divine power of physical strength possessed by the wheel-turning sage king.

That wheel-turning king, as a karmic reward, has a delightful and upright appearance, which is always enjoyed by the world, the most supreme and wonderful, with a pure physical body, and is fully adorned.

At that time, there was no one born among humans who could attain such a handsome and delightful appearance, which people in the world wished to see, like that of the wheel-turning king, who was endowed with form.
This is called the third spiritual power of the wheel-turning sage king, the power of appearance.
Furthermore, bhiká¹£us!
That wheel-turning king, due to the causes and conditions of karmic retribution, has great blessings and virtues, namely, various abundant resources and treasures complete with worldly rarities.
At that time, there was no one born among humans who had such wealth and such possessions, with many adornments and overflowing treasures, who could equal the wheel-turning king.
This is called the fourth spiritual power of the wheel-turning sage king, the power of karmic retribution.
Bhiká¹£us!
If one possesses these four kinds of spiritual powers, then one is called a wheel-turning sage king.
Bhiká¹£us!
Moreover, that blessed wheel-turning sage king is loved and respected by the people, and his mind is always joyful, just as children love and respect their father;
and the people are pitied and kindly thought of by the wheel-turning king, just as a father loves his children.
Bhiká¹£us!
When the wheel-turning king sits in the most excellent and good chariot called Vijaya, and wishes to go out on a tour to view the gardens, forests, and good lands,
at that time, when the people see the wheel-turning king, they all greatly rejoice and together tell the charioteer, saying:
O good charioteer, please hold the reins slowly and slowly, do not go too fast.
Why is it so?
If you drive the chariot slowly and leisurely, we wish to be able to see the Sage King for a long time.'
The wheel-turning king, having heard this, also said to the charioteer in the same way:
'O good charioteer, drive slowly and carefully, do not be hasty.
Why is it so?
If you drive the chariot well and hold it steady, it will allow me to look around at the people for a long time like this.'

When the people saw the wheel-turning king, they each took their precious treasures and offered them to the wheel-turning sage king, saying:
'We now present this to Heaven. These things belong to Heaven. May Heaven accept them and use them as Heaven wishes. These things are only suitable for Heaven to use.'
Bhiká¹£us!

When the wheel-turning king appears in the world, this JambudvÄ«pa is pure and level, without thorns, thickets, hills, pits, or other foul and smelly places, and naturally endowed with the seven treasures of gold, silver, and so forth, not cold or hot, with a balanced climate.
